photo.description: This is the Hoover Dam, 2 years ago or so, taken on a family trip to Vegas. I know what you're thinking, family trip to Vegas. Yep. Never again! But we had fun, saw the Painted Desert, the Grand Canyon (or as my daughter calls it, a great big hole). Three trips to Vegas though and I have yet to go on the Dam tour

photo.description: Nevada is on the left bank, Arizona on the right. Hoover dam was built in the Great Depression between 1931 and 1936, provides power and controls the flow of water downstream. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoover_Dam The Hoover Dam by-pass bridge on Route 93 is under construction and opened in October 2010. www.hooverdambypass.org/

Las Vegas w Peta 09-26-12 Hoover Dam 047

photo.description: The Hoover Dam is mind boggling in its immensity. I don't know if any of my photos capture just how huge it is. In this one, you can see a huge yellow truck on the roadway at the base of the dam. The water released at the base of the damn is constantly churning, with swirls of froth marbling the vivid green-blue.
photo.tags: architecture nevada arizona dam hoover lake mead cement construction river huge summer travel roadtrip cliff
